txt.en: 'Do not worry. We'll be back soon.'
The Great Eagle your party has been following has inexplicably disappeared.
You and Elrohir have returned to Pembar to find Elladan waiting with the Great Eagle Gwaihir.\n\nYou should talk to Gwaihir.
DNT
Talk to Elrohir
'Here comes more of them!'
Follow Elrohir
Whatever creature created these footprints may be dangerous.\n\nYou should follow Elrohir and help him track it down.
DNT
'They might also be fooling us. I am not as convinced.'
The footprints continue to the south-west
'Wait, up ahead. Is that a dead boar?'
'I'll follow your lead.'
'Then I shall take my leave. Good fortune on your travels.'
'We should rest here and gather our strength before continuing. We have yet to embark on the most difficult part of our journey.'
'Why would the Eagle ignore us? Could I have been mistaken about his location?'
Talk to Elrohir
Talk to Gwaihir
Listen to the twins' discussion
'More dead boars...'
'Though I wonder why the wolves near the Anduin have grown bolder...'
The footprints continue to the south-west
Examine the large footprints
'[placeholder], take a look at those footprints.'
You should talk to Elrohir.
'I shall stay here, just in case. Be careful.'
Mission: The Further Adventures of Elladan & Elrohir, Chapter 2
Talk to Elrohir
'Do not relax just yet!'
'That must be the drake we're looking for! A matron, no less.'
Follow Elrohir
Defeat the drakes
'[placeholder], I'm certain the Eagle noticed our presence and flew here, but I don't see him. Do you?'\n\nElrohir surveys the area outside the ruins and frowns.
'Elladan, we'll take a look around.'

'Greetings. You have my thanks for defeating the drakes. I had no desire to involve myself with them, seeing as how they do not threaten me or my kin, but they did not care for my presence. At least I may now deliver my message more easily.\n\n'We have not discovered any sign of the Black Riders, nor any other tidings of the Enemy's servants. However, wolves gather along the banks of the Anduin in great numbers. What this indicates, I cannot say I know.'
'If even your people haven't seen the Riders, then they must've disappeared from the North.'
'I suppose the drakelings hated having their meal interrupted.'
Something's not right.\n\nYou should check the surrounding area with Elrohir.
'Those drakes didn't match up with the footprints. Our work isn't done yet.'
You and Elrohir have found a dead boar next to a set of large footprints.\n\nYou should examine the footprints.
You should listen to the twins' discussion about Gwaihir's report.
'[placeholder], watch out!'
'Thank you, Gwaihir. Your efforts are much appreciated.'
You should talk to Elrohir to see what he's discovered.

'Whatever killed these boars was an even match in size for our friend.' Elrohir holds up a feather that is certainly too large to belong to any normal bird. 'It seems I wasn't wrong about his location after all. He must have left the area once he realized he had intruded on something's territory.

'Of course, I doubt that creature, whatever it is, was an even match in power. After all, the Eagles are a more than capable folk. But this creature may be dangerous to anyone travelling through this area, and that does not bode well for our errand.

'Let's track it down.'
DNT
'Well fought, [placeholder].'
You and Elrohir have tracked down the drake matron.\n\nDefeating it would make the area safer for travellers passing through Eregion.
The drake matron has been defeated.\n\nYou should talk to Elrohir.
'That drake matron commanded a most fearsome brood! It'll be safer here now, though I fear that will change.\n\n'We ought to head back to Pembar; Elladan must be wondering where we are.'
